page.title: 11TEENAGE DISCO - HEDNESFORD
page.content: Apart from the Guides and Cubs (for the younger people) the disco is the main event of the week. It is usually held on Mondays and Fridays at the Aquarius Ballroom, Hednesford. The disco is run by voluntary helpers and the local police and is supported by S.P.A.C.E. ( Staffordshire Police Activity and Community Enterprise ). Although the disco was opened at the beginning of October 1983, it was not the first disco - the first was run by the Council. When the police disco first opened, numbers were few (approx. 100), but now they have risen to 1464. Since the opening of the disco, over 2000 pounds has been raised, which has gone to various groups: the S.P.A.C.E. scheme; senior citizens and local charities. Attendants come from schools all over the area and are always welcome.
